description.narrative:
As this year elections will take place in Myanmar, the project shall focus on women's participation in elections. Bolstering women#s political participation and leadership remains a priority for Oxfam in Myanmar and the national elections are a critical moment for further driving forward our public campaigning efforts on this critical issue. With the currently dismal level of women#s representation in the formal political sphere, with women accounting for a mere 10% of MPs, the year ahead is a moment when gendered stereotypes must be further deconstructed and women#s leadership promoted and celebrated.
As such, the Oxfam team will work with several women#s rights organizations to leverage existing work and alliances to implement a creative and engaging public campaign that renders visible women#s leadership role, challenges assumptions and engages key stakeholders, including political parties and religious leaders, in championing women#s participation in the electoral process. This is also a strategicopportunity for Oxfam in Myanmar to further strengthen and expand its collaborations with key women#s rights organizations in the country, a critical lever for change.
Activities: Support and champion women#s political participation and leadership ahead of 2020 elections together with women#s rights organizations through a Social Media Campaign, Training of Selected enumerators, Series of Panel Discussion, Community Theatre, Direct Advocacy, Coordination Meeting, Social Media Monitoring, Grants to Gender Equality Network, Public Photo booth/ Photo exhibition,Campaign events in Kachin/Rakhine/Mon.
Beyond, this project will allow implementation of 2 co-funidng projects - an EU funded project on Land and Extractives and an European Civil Protection and Humanitarian Aid Operations (ECHO) HIP 2020 project providing a humanitarian fund.

participating-org.narrative:
Oxfam great Britain is managing Oxfam in Myanmar. It has an office in Yangon since 2009 and operates in 5 townships as stipulated in its MOU with the Ministry of Agriculture and Irrigation.
Oxfam’s vision for Myanmar is for all citizens, including women and ethnic nationalities, to be able to enjoy their social, cultural, economic, civil and political rights. We believe it is possible for Myanmar to be led by a government that is responsive and accountable to its citizens; to have a political system everyone can be part of and have a dynamic private sector which works in the interests of the poorest. The focus of our work is now:
Empowering communities to exercise their own rights and increase their influence on local policies and resource allocation; promoting an accountable civil society which is able to drive pro-poor policies and equitable change. Building a responsive local government which can respond to the priorities of its people, engaging networks of communities, civil society and local government in order to work with a widerange of national and international actors. Increasing the participation of women in society, helping them to gain positions of leadership and to participate in decision making processes at all levels. Working towards a pro-poor private sector to ensure the private sector and the government adopt business practices and policies which benefit poor and vulnerable people.
To achieve our goals, the Oxfam Country strategy focuses on three thematic areas of work: Governance and Social Accountability, Economic Justice, and Humanitarian. Gender Equality is a core element in all programs, ensuring that we put women at the centre of everything we do.
